title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [5? july 1870]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [5? July 1870]
text: July 12 1870 (?)tuesdayTuesdayMy dear Walti received your letter on mondayMonday glad to hear you get along so well every one seems to complain so much of the weather itsit's hot to be shuresure but itsit's no use fretting about it well Walt i have been to day and had my picture taken i have been saving money for it for this 2 months and to day i have been to pendletonsPendleton's on the corner of fultonFulton and johnson stJohnson St. and had six large ones taken i went alone i told the man i wanted very extraordinary ones ferfor the were to go to a distance and he said he would take the best that could be taken i set three times the last one did look very good the others was good only the eyes wasentwasn't so good they will cost nearly 20 dollar yours and georgesGeorge's i will have framed and one for myself i shall send han one in the package so you see waltWalt i bequeath something to my children so they will not forget me) i hear nothin from Jeff and matt maybeemaybe they are away) good bie walterWalter dear i will give the book to helen Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [5? July 1870]
